[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Flight Management System (FMS) defines requirements for flight scheduling, pilot assignments, and aircraft tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: FMS supports airline operations, real-time flight monitoring, pilot scheduling, and aircraft maintenance tracking.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: FMS integrates with airline databases, airport systems, and pilot records for scheduling and compliance tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: FMS provides web-based and mobile dashboards for administrators, pilots, and schedulers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: FMS supports desktop workstations, mobile devices for pilots, and integration with control tower systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: FMS uses PostgreSQL for structured storage  REST APIs for flight scheduling  pilot assignments  aircraft tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: FMS secures all communications via TLS encryption and multi-factor authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: FMS is optimized for high-frequency flight operations and real-time status updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: FMS manages flight scheduling  pilot availability  aircraft readiness tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: FMS is configurable for commercial and private airline operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: FMS connects with air traffic control  maintenance  and compliance reporting systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: FMS schedules flights  assigns pilots  tracks aircraft statuses  and ensures compliance with aviation regulations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for airline administrators  flight schedulers  pilots  and maintenance staff managing airline operations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: FMS requires continuous network connectivity for real-time flight monitoring and scheduling.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: FMS relies on accurate flight schedules  pilot availability  aircraft maintenance records.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with airport databases for tracking flight schedules, departures, and arrivals.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall synchronize aircraft maintenance data.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall schedule flights, assign pilots based on availability, and track aircraft operational status (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall ensure each flight has a pilot, co-pilot, and captain (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall track aircraft states, including working, under repair, airborne, and landed (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a dashboard for flight and pilot management.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process scheduling and pilot assignments within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store flight schedules, pilot assignments, and aircraft details.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store pilot data, including experience and roles.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store aircraft status, maintenance records, and logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce authentication, role-based access controls, encrypted communication, and activity logging.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with aviation regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log flight changes, pilot assignments, and aircraft status updates.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests scheduling, assignments, aircraft tracking, and maintenance logs.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, compliance manuals.
[SEC] 5. References: Aviation regulations, airline policies, and air traffic control standards.
